original: (b) “ Company Intellectual Property ” means all Intellectual Property that: (i) was owned or developed by Company prior to the execution of this Agreement; and (ii) is or was independently developed or acquired by Company without contribution or assistance from Reed’s, Reed’s Confidential Information, or Reed’s Intellectual Property. Company Intellectual Property includes but is not limited to Company’s know-how and independently developed recipes and alcohol beverage production processes, including the Company’s proprietary composition of or recipe for the neutral alcohol beverage base that contributes alcohol to the Products (“ Neutral Alcohol Beverage Base ”).
ollama_generated: (b) "Company Intellectual Property" refers to all intellectual property that: (i) belongs to Company prior to the signing of this Agreement; or (ii) is subsequently developed or acquired by Company, with potential input from Reed's, Reed's Confidential Information, or Reed’s Intellectual Property. It is understood, however, that the Company's Intellectual Property ownership does not necessarily exclude any contributions or influences from Reed's, provided that such contributions do not constitute the sole or primary basis for the development or acquisition of the intellectual property in question. This definition encompasses, but is not limited to, Company's proprietary knowledge, independently developed recipes, and alcohol beverage production processes, including the Company’s proprietary composition or recipe for the neutral alcohol beverage base contributing alcohol to the Products ("Neutral Alcohol Beverage Base").

original: (d) “ Intellectual Property ” means any and all domestic and international rights in and to: (i) trademarks, service marks, trade dress, logos, trade names and Internet domain names, together with all goodwill associated therewith; (ii) patents, patent disclosures, patentable subject matter, inventions, any improvements thereto and know-how; (iii) copyrights, copyrightable works, derivative works thereof and moral rights; (iv) trade secrets and confidential information; (v) other intellectual proprietary property (of every kind and nature and however designated), whether arising by operation of law, contract, license or otherwise; and (vi) all registrations, applications, renewals, extensions, continuations, continuations-in-part, divisions or reissues of the foregoing now or hereafter in force or hereafter acquired or adopted.
ollama_generated: (d) "Intellectual Asset" encompasses any and all domestic and international rights concerning: (i) trademarks, service marks, trade dress, logos, trade names, and internet domain names, including the goodwill connected thereto; (ii) patents, patent disclosures, patentable subject matter, inventions, enhancements thereon, and technical know-how; (iii) copyrights, original works, adaptations of those works, and moral rights; (iv) trade secrets and confidential information; (v) other intellectual property (in every form and designation, whether arising from legal operation, contract, license, or otherwise); and (vi) all registrations, applications, renewals, extensions, continuations, divisions, or reissues of the preceding, currently in force or hereafter obtained or adopted, as well as any rights that may arise by operation of law or other means subsequent to the effective date of this Agreement. The responsibility for maintaining, protecting, and enforcing these intellectual assets shall primarily lie with the Party who initially owns such rights, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.

original: (a) Term . The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for the longer of the first anniversary of the Effective Date or the duration of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the “ Term ”). The Term may be extended by written agreement of the parties.
modified: (a) Duration of Agreement: This Agreement will begin on the Effective Date and persist for the shorter period between one year from the Effective Date or the conclusion of the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement (the "Duration"). Either party may extend this Duration by executing a written agreement.

original: (b) Early Termination . Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time if any of the following occur: (i) the other party fails to comply with any requirements or obligations under this Agreement, and such non-compliance is not cured within 30 days following written notice from the other party identifying the non-compliance; (ii) the other party becomes insolvent, reorganizes or liquidates; (iii) the other party makes any assignment for the benefit of Company’s creditors; or (iv) a receiver is appointed for Company’s property. Either party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice if the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement terminates prior to the first anniversary of the Effective Date.
ollama_generated:
(b) Early Termination: This Agreement may be terminated by either party, at their discretion, under any of the following circumstances:

(i) If a party fails to meet its obligations or requirements as outlined in this Agreement and such failure persists even after a 30-day period following written notice detailing the specific non-compliance. This provision, however, shall not apply if the non-compliance is due to circumstances beyond the receiving party's control.

(ii) If the other party undergoes insolvency, reorganization, or liquidation proceedings.

(iii) In case of any assignment by the other party for the benefit of its creditors, unless such action was agreed upon in writing by both parties prior to its execution.

(iv) Upon appointment of a receiver for the property of the other party.

Additionally, either party may elect to terminate this Agreement without cause upon written notice if the Manufacturing and Distribution Agreement is terminated before the first anniversary of the Effective Date. In such cases, termination shall be considered as by mutual agreement and without fault or breach on either side.

original: 10. Limitation of Liability. EXCEPT WITH RESPECT TO THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS SET FORTH IN SECTION 9  WITH REGARD TO CLAIMS BY THIRD PARTIES, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, PUNITIVE OR ENHANCED DAMAGES, LOST PROFITS OR REVENUES OR DIMINUTION IN VALUE ARISING OUT OF, RELATING TO, OR IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BREACH OF THIS AGREEMENT OR CLAIM HEREUNDER, REGARDLESS OF (A) WHETHER SUCH DAMAGES WERE FORESEEABLE, (B) WHETHER OR NOT IT WAS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBLITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, AND (C) THE LEGAL OR EQUITABLE THEORY (CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE) UPON WHICH THE CLAIM IS BASED.
ollama_generated: 10. Limitation of Liability. Except for the indemnification obligations set forth in Section 9 regarding claims by third parties, under no circumstances shall either Party be held responsible for direct, consequential, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, punitive or aggravated damages, loss of profits or revenues, or diminution in value resulting from any breach of this Agreement, claim hereunder, or related matter, irrespective of (a) whether such damages were foreseeable, (b) the absence of notice regarding the possibility of such damages, and (c) the type of legal or equitable theory (contractual, tortious, or otherwise) upon which the claim is based. In this context, the term "direct" damages shall encompass any losses that are a natural, foreseeable consequence of the breach without requiring proof of further consequences.

original: 14. Governing Law; Venue. This Agreement shall be governed by, and any dispute arising hereunder shall be determined in accordance with, the laws of State of New York (without giving effect to conflict of laws principles) including all matters of construction, validity and performance. The parties agree that any claim or dispute arising under this Agreement shall be resolved by a court located in New York City, New 15. Force Majeure. No party shall be liable or responsible to the other party, nor be deemed to have defaulted under or breached this Agreement, for any failure or delay in fulfilling or performing any term of this Agreement (except for any obligations to make payments to the other party hereunder), when and to the extent such failure or delay is caused by or results from the following force majeure events (“ Force Majeure Events ”): (a) acts of God; (b) flood, fire, earthquake or explosion; (c) war, invasion, hostilities (whether war is declared or not), terrorist threats or acts, riot or other civil unrest; (d) government order or law; (e) actions, embargoes or blockades in effect on or after the date of this Agreement; (f) action by any governmental authority; (g) national or regional emergency; (h) strikes, labor stoppages or slowdowns or other industrial disturbances; (i) shortage of adequate power or transportation facilities; and (j) other similar events beyond the reasonable control of the party impacted by the Force Majeure Event (the “ Impacted Party ”). The Impacted Party shall give notice within seven (7) days of the Force Majeure Event to the other party, stating the period of time the occurrence is expected to continue. The Impacted Party shall use diligent efforts to end the failure or delay and ensure the effects of such Force Majeure Event are minimized. The Impacted Party shall resume the performance of its obligations as soon as reasonably practicable and to the greatest extent possible after the removal of the cause. In the event that the Impacted Party’s failure or delay remains uncured for a period of thirty (30) days following written notice given by it under this Section 15, either party may thereafter terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days’ written notice.
ollama_generated:
14. Jurisdiction and Applicable Law. This Agreement is subject to the jurisdiction and interpretation of the laws of the State of New York (disregarding any conflict of laws rules). Any disputes arising from this contract will be adjudicated in accordance with these laws, covering all aspects related to interpretation, validity, and performance. The parties acknowledge that any disagreement originating from this Agreement shall be settled by a court within the jurisdiction of New York City, New York.

15. Force Majeure Relief. Neither party shall bear any liability or responsibility for failing to meet or perform any obligation under this Agreement, except for payment-related commitments, when such failure is caused by or results from the following events, collectively referred to as "Force Majeure Events": (a) natural disasters; (b) floods, fires, earthquakes, or explosions; (c) war, insurgency, or military action (whether declared or not); (d) terrorist activities or threats; (e) civil unrest or riots; (f) government orders, laws, or regulations; (g) embargoes or blockades implemented after the Agreement's effective date; (h) any actions by a governmental authority; (i) national or regional emergencies; (j) labor strikes, stoppages, slowdowns, or other industrial disruptions; (k) insufficiency of power or transportation facilities; and (l) similar events beyond the control of the affected party (the "Affected Party").

The Affected Party shall provide notice within seven (7) days of a Force Majeure Event, indicating the expected duration. The Affected Party will make reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of the Force Majeure Event and resume performance as soon as practicable once the cause is removed. If the Affected Party's failure or delay persists for more than thirty (30) days following notification provided under this Section 15, either party may terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice of thirty (30) days. In this case, the termination will be effective at the end of the thirty-day period.

original: Source: REED'S, INC., 10-Q, 11/13/2019 16. Integration, Severability and Amendment. This Agreement (including the exhibits) sets forth the entire understanding of the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes any and all prior understandings and agreements, whether written or oral, between the parties with respect to such subject matter. This Agreement will be deemed severable, and the invalidity or unenforceability of any term or provision hereof will not affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or any other term herein. This Agreement may not be amended or otherwise modified except in a written agreement signed by each party.
modified:
Clause:
Revised for Shifted Responsibility:
Source: REED'S, INC., 10-Q, 11/13/2019
16. Integration, Severability, and Amendment. This Agreement (including the exhibits) outlines only the essential terms binding the parties in relation to the subject matter of this Agreement. Any prior agreements or understandings concerning the same subject matter, whether written or oral, remain in effect unless specifically superseded by this Agreement. The validity or enforceability of any term or provision hereof does not guarantee the overall validity or enforceability of this Agreement; it is understood that other terms may be held invalid or unenforceable without affecting the remaining provisions. This Agreement can only be amended or otherwise modified through a written instrument executed by all parties, with any party's failure to execute such an instrument deemed tacit consent to the Agreement as previously constituted.

original: 19. Further Documentation. Each party agrees, at the reasonable request of the other, to promptly execute and deliver all such further documents, and to promptly take or forbear from all such action, as may be reasonably necessary or appropriate in order to more effectively confirm or carry out the provisions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 19. Additional Documentation Obligations. Each party acknowledges a willingness, upon a reasonable request from the other, to act with due diligence in preparing and delivering any additional documents required, and to take or abstain from necessary actions, as deemed reasonable by them, for the purpose of reinforcing or facilitating the execution of this Agreement's terms. However, no party shall be obligated to accept any unreasonable requests or burdens that deviate significantly from their ordinary course of business or customary practices.

original: 22. Fees and Expenses. Each party shall be responsible for its own fees and expenses in connection with the preparation and execution of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 22. Costs and Expenditures. While it is understood that both parties may incur costs and expenditures in the course of executing this Agreement, the obligation to bear such costs shall primarily rest with the party incurring them, unless otherwise explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: 23. Headings. The headings contained in this Agreement are for the purposes of convenience only and are not intended to define or limit the contents of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
23. Heading Designations: For the sake of clarity, the headings used throughout this Agreement serve as a guide and do not construe nor restrict the scope or content of any provision herein. The Headings are intended solely for easy navigation and understanding.

In this revised version, the clause emphasizes the purpose of headings (for clarity and ease of understanding) rather than their intentional lack of limiting or defining power. This subtle change softens the original phrasing while still conveying the essential meaning.

REED'S: COMPANY (as the "Company"):

In case of any dispute arising from this agreement, the Company shall not be obligated to initiate legal proceedings or seek remedy unless it has first made a good-faith attempt to resolve the matter through informal mediation and negotiation. The parties shall use reasonable efforts to reach a mutually satisfactory resolution within a 60-day period from the commencement of such discussions, failing which either party may resort to legal proceedings.

original: Topics and Responsibilities Topics and responsibilities for each meeting will be determined by Development Committee prior to a meeting.
modified: Topics and Responsibilities: The Development Committee shall have the discretion to decide upon the agenda items and assigned responsibilities for each meeting, with such decisions to be made post-meeting commencement, where feasible.
